channel.title: Combining Files to an Application?
channel.description:
[b]* Used Google Already :rolleyes:[/b]
I've been [b]really[/b] wanting to make an application (*.exe) for a while now, And I only know so little. The only thing I know is you use configuration settings files and stuff like this to make the File menu at the top ;):
[code][Menue] 11=File 12=Settings 13=Etc... [/code] And yet, I don't know how to make anything access it. So... If someone can either help me fuse them to a .exe file, or help me at all, I'd greatly appreciate it :)

item.title: Combining Files to an Application?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“thiefmn6092, post:9, topic:101508”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=145557.msg1388616#msg1388616 date=1180354617]
I suggest you look up Delphi.

Short description: Delphi is a RAD, or Rapid Application Development tool.
[/quote]
Delphi isnt to bad, i wouldn’t suggest it though.[/quote]

It’s generally my first choice for this forum, since SCAR uses the same syntax as Delphi, it’s easier to get used to, and VB6 is becoming out-dated.

Read full topic

item.title: Combining Files to an Application?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Or, you can be an uber noob like me and wrap an executable over a Java Jar exectuable using JSmooth.

Read full topic

I Googled it XD

item.title: Combining Files to an Application?
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

goto libertybasic.com . It was the first programming language I learned, and it’s really easy once you get the hang of it.

Read full topic

item.title: Combining Files to an Application?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:2, topic:101508”]I suggest you look up Delphi.

Short description: Delphi is a RAD, or Rapid Application Development tool.[/quote] Didn’t really find a download

[quote=“Ron, post:3, topic:101508”]Delphi is normally for software newbies (like me). You might want to try it out, but if you want the most control over your application go for a C compiler.

C and C++ give you complete control over your application and you can pretty much do anything. It’s a little tricky to learn but worth it.[/quote] My cousin is trying to learn it. He has a huge book of his dad’s, and so far all he knows is batch making, which is almost just like Java and regular batch file making put together. Like you can make ints, and use put for echo

And anyways, thanks. I’ll learn C++ I guess.

Read full topic

item.title: Combining Files to an Application?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Delphi is normally for software newbies (like me). You might want to try it out, but if you want the most control over your application go for a C compiler.

C and C++ give you complete control over your application and you can pretty much do anything. It’s a little tricky to learn but worth it.

Read full topic
